flounder.sounds

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.sounds.Sound

  • public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single sound effect. Holds a reference to the sound's file, and a reference to any buffers containing loaded data of the sound.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void delete()
      Sends a request for the sound to be deleted.
      int getBufferID() 
      int getBytesRead() 
      MyFile getSoundFile() 
      float getVolume() 
      boolean isLoaded() 
      static Sound loadSoundInBackground(MyFile file, float volume)
      Sends a request to the resource loading thread for the sound to be loaded.
      static Sound loadSoundNow(MyFile file, float volume)
      Loads a sound file and loads some (possibly all for short sounds) of the sound data into an OpenAL buffer.
      boolean needsStreaming()
      When initially loading a sound only a certain number of bytes are read.
      void setBuffer(int buffer, int bytesRead)
      Sets the buffer containing (at least some of) the sound's audio data.
      void setTotalBytes(int totalBytes)
      Sets the total number of bytes of audio data in the sound's file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • loadSoundNow

        public static Sound loadSoundNow(MyFile file,
                                 float volume)
        Loads a sound file and loads some (possibly all for short sounds) of the sound data into an OpenAL buffer.
        Parameters:
        file - The sound file.
        volume - Used to change the base volume of a sound effect.
        Returns:
        A new sound object which represents the loaded sound.

      • loadSoundInBackground

        public static Sound loadSoundInBackground(MyFile file,
                                          float volume)
        Sends a request to the resource loading thread for the sound to be loaded.
        Parameters:
        file - The sound file.
        volume - Used to change the base volume of a sound effect.
        Returns:
        A new sound object which represents the loaded sound.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Sends a request for the sound to be deleted.

      • getBufferID

        public int getBufferID()
        Returns:
        The ID of the sound's buffer.

      • setBuffer

        public void setBuffer(int buffer,
                      int bytesRead)
        Sets the buffer containing (at least some of) the sound's audio data. It also indicates how many bytes of the sound's data has been loaded into the buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The ID of the OpenAL buffer which contains the sound's loaded audio data.
        bytesRead - The number of bytes of the sound's audio which have been loaded into the buffer.

      • getSoundFile

        public MyFile getSoundFile()
        Returns:
        The sound file.

      • getVolume

        public float getVolume()
        Returns:
        The base volume of the sound.

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded()
        Returns:
        Whether the sound is loaded or not.

      • needsStreaming

        public boolean needsStreaming()
        When initially loading a sound only a certain number of bytes are read. If the sound file for this sound contains more bytes than the number of bytes which were initially loaded then the sound file needs to be streamed when played.
        Returns:
        true if the sound file needs streaming when it's played.

      • getBytesRead

        public int getBytesRead()
        Returns:
        The number of bytes from the sound's file that have already been loaded.

      • setTotalBytes

        public void setTotalBytes(int totalBytes)
        Sets the total number of bytes of audio data in the sound's file.
        Parameters:
        totalBytes - The total number of bytes of data.
